over25.text: How will the employer split the total contribution with covered individuals?
helpText: Since the employer has 25 or more covered individuals, it is required to pay at least 60% of the medical leave contribution. The employer may pay a larger portion of the total contribution if it chooses to do so.

under25.text: How will the employer split the total contribution with covered individuals?
helpText: Employers with fewer than 25 covered individuals are not required to pay the employer share of the medical leave contribution, but may choose to contribute in order to reduce the amounts paid by covered individuals in their workforce.
